alert.note: Alert for De Witt; Logan; Macon (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 22 at 7:53AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Illinois, including the following counties, De Witt, Logan and Macon. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 748 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain fell over this area last night. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen in the advisory area. - A segment of Rte 54 between Mt Pulaski and Chestnut is currently closed do to water over the road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Pulaski, Latham and Chestnut. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
